artifacts.content:
{
  "market_analysis": {
    "tam": {
      "value": "$3.5 billion",
      "calculation": "Estimated global DevOps tools market (Gartner 2024) + adjacent CI/CD and developer productivity tools",
      "source_type": "industry_report"
    },
    "sam": {
      "value": "$950 million",
      "calculation": "Estimated 25% of TAM addressable for enterprise-focused DevOps platforms in the US and EU",
      "geographic_scope": "US & EU"
    },
    "som": {
      "value": "$65 million",
      "calculation": "Estimated 7% of SAM achievable in Year 1 as a new entrant with strong enterprise focus",
      "assumptions": [
        "Successful launch with 5 Fortune 500 customers",
        "Rapid adoption in developer-centric organizations",
        "Minimal churn in first year"
      ]
    },
    "growth_rate": "12.5% CAGR",
    "market_stage": "growing",
    "timing_assessment": "DevOps and developer tooling is a fast-growing market, with enterprises increasingly adopting integrated solutions. The timing is favorable as organizations seek more visibility and control over their software development lifecycle."
  },
  "competitors": [
    {
      "name": "CircleCI",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Continuous integration and delivery platform",
      "strengths": [
        "Strong brand recognition",
        "Large enterprise customer base",
        "Extensive integrations"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited visibility beyond CI/CD",
        "Steep learning curve",
        "Pricing can be complex"
      ],
      "pricing": "$15/mo per user + $50/mo per concurrent build",
      "market_share_estimate": "25% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "Pioneering CI/CD experience",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "Jenkins",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Open-source automation server for CI/CD",
      "strengths": [
        "Free and open-source",
        "Highly customizable",
        "Large community"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Steep learning curve",
        "Self-hosting required",
        "Limited enterprise features"
      ],
      "pricing": "Free",
      "market_share_estimate": "20% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "Flexibility and community support",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    },
    {
      "name": "Azure DevOps",
      "type": "indirect",
      "description": "Microsoft's DevOps solution integrated with Azure",
      "strengths": [
        "Tight integration with Azure",
        "Enterprise-grade security",
        "Familiar Microsoft ecosystem"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited cross-platform support",
        "Pricing can be high for non-Azure users",
        "Less flexibility than open-source"
      ],
      "pricing": "$6-$30/user/mo",
      "market_share_estimate": "15% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "Azure platform integration",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "trends": [
    {
      "trend": "Shift-left testing and security",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Increased demand for tools that integrate security and testing earlier in the development lifecycle",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Hybrid and multi-cloud adoption",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Need for DevOps tools that work seamlessly across different cloud environments",
      "timeline": "1-2 years",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Emphasis on developer experience",
      "type": "consumer",
      "impact": "Developers expect more intuitive and user-friendly DevOps tooling",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    }
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "Comprehensive build visibility and insights",
      "Integrated constitutional checks",
      "Contextual chat for developer support"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "New entrant in a crowded market",
      "Potential adoption challenges for enterprises used to legacy tools"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Differentiate with a focus on developer experience and ease of use",
      "Leverage AI/ML for intelligent build optimization"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Established players like CircleCI and Azure DevOps improving user experience",
      "Potential for open-source tools like Jenkins to add more enterprise features"
    ]
  },
  "opportunities": [
    "Provide a more intuitive and user-friendly DevOps platform focused on developer experience",
    "Integrate advanced AI/ML capabilities for intelligent build optimization and recommendations"
  ],
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Slow enterprise adoption due to existing toolchain investments",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Emphasize seamless integration with common CI/CD tools, offer migration assistance, and provide compelling ROI calculations"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Potential for open-source tools to add more enterprise features",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Continuously innovate and differentiate with unique features, maintain a strong developer community, and leverage AI/ML capabilities"
    }
  ],
  "recommendation": {
    "market_attractiveness": "8/10 - Growing market with clear opportunities for differentiation",
    "entry_timing": "now",
    "key_success_factors": [
      "Exceptional developer experience",
      "Intelligent build optimization",
      "Seamless integration with common toolchain"
    ]
  }
}

{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A comprehensive build console that provides real-time visibility and control over the OLYMPUS build process",
    "target_user": "Power users and developers who need deep understanding of their builds",
    "key_differentiator": "Unique insights into the build pipeline and agent activities, not found in generic CI/CD tools"
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 10,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Shows a list of active and completed builds with status indicators",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to see a list of my builds so I can track their progress and review past builds"
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases with status indicators",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to see the current status of each build phase so I can understand where my build is in the pipeline"
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Lists all agents involved in the build process with their current status",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to see who is working on my build and what they're doing so I can understand the build workflow"
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 82,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Displays the status of key constitutional checks for the build",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to see if my build is compliant with the OLYMPUS constitution so I can be confident in the build process"
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 80,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and known risks",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to understand the reasoning behind the build decisions so I can better maintain and extend my application"
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 70,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 6,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build",
      "user_story": "As a user, I want to be able to ask questions about my build and get answers from the OLYMPUS team, so I can better understand the process"
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status",
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Minimum Viable Product"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Enhanced Build Console"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "ongoing",
      "features": [
        "build_history_analytics",
        "agent_performance_tracking",
        "constitutional_violation_alerts"
      ],
      "milestone": "Scaling and Optimization"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase (PostgreSQL)",
      "auth": "Supabase Auth"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase for database and real-time updates",
      "Lucide React for icons"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<2s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT-based authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive on desktop",
      "Core user flows completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can navigate the build console and find the information they need in <2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in core flows",
      "Positive user feedback on visibility and understanding of the build process"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List Panel",
        "description": "Shows a list of active and completed builds with status indicators",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table of builds with columns for build name, status (queued, running, completed, failed), start time, end time, and duration",
          "Status indicators use traffic light colors (green, yellow, red) to quickly convey build health",
          "Clicking on a build row navigates to the individual build detail page",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches build data from /api/builds endpoint",
          "Skeleton loader shown while data is loading"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
        "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases with status indicators",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a timeline view of the build phases: discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment",
          "Each phase shows its status (pending, active, completed, failed) with a corresponding traffic light indicator",
          "Phases are laid out horizontally with start and end times displayed",
          "Clicking on a phase navigates to the individual build detail page and scrolls to that phase",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches phase data from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
        "description": "Lists all agents involved in the build process with their current status",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a list of all 35 agents organized by build phase",
          "Each agent shows their name, role description, current status (idle, working, completed, failed), and their current task (if working)",
          "Agent status is indicated using traffic light colors (green, yellow, red)",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches agent data from /api/ai/agents endpoint",
          "Skeleton loader shown while data is loading"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
        "description": "Displays the status of key constitutional checks for the build",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays up to 7 constitutional checks with their status (compliant, warning, violation) and a brief explanation",
          "Status is indicated using traffic light colors (green, yellow, red)",
          "Checks are: No Shipping Without Understanding, Constitutional Tests Pass, Intent Satisfaction, Hostile Resistance, Stability Envelope, Architecture Integrity, Explanation Provided",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches constitutional status from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint",
          "Skeleton loader shown while data is loading"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 82
      },
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
        "description": "Provides insights into what was built, why it was built that way, and known risks",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays three sections: 'What was built', 'Why it was built this way', and 'Known risks'",
          "'What was built' lists the generated components and files",
          "'Why it was built this way' explains the key decisions and reasoning behind the build",
          "'Known risks' lists any identified risks and their mitigation status",
          "No hardcoded data - fetches information from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint",
          "Skeleton loader shown while data is loading"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 80
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
        "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays as a collapsible side panel, only active when a build is selected",
          "Provides a chat interface for users to ask questions about the current build",
          "Questions are routed to the OLYMPUS team for responses",
          "Responses are displayed in the chat panel",
          "Chat history is persisted for the duration of the current build session"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 70
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": [
      {
        "id": "build_history_analytics",
        "name": "Build History Analytics",
        "description": "Provides historical build data and performance insights"
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_performance_tracking",
        "name": "Agent Performance Tracking",
        "description": "Tracks individual agent performance and productivity"
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_violation_alerts",
        "name": "Constitutional Violation Alerts",
        "description": "Proactively alerts users to potential constitutional violations"
      }
    ]
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Complexity of integrating data from multiple API endpoints",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Implement a centralized data fetching and caching layer to abstract API complexity"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Ensuring consistent styling and UI across all panels",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Leverage Tailwind CSS utilities and a design system to maintain visual consistency"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Providing meaningful explanations for build decisions and risks",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Work closely with ORACLE and EMPATHY to capture the right level of detail and context"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Delivering a performant and responsive experience",
      "probability": "low",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Optimize data fetching, implement server-side rendering, and leverage Tailwind's responsive utilities"
    }
  ]
}

decisions.reasoning: The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard is a focused MVP with a clear set of features. A monolithic architecture simplifies development and deployment, allowing a quick iteration cycle for power users and developers. Given the complexity and number of entities, this approach avoids unnecessary overhead.
